objdescid.origination: William Blake author, inventor, delineator. This receipt is written and signed by Blake.

provenance.name: City of Westminster Archives Centre
provenance.note: Thomas Butts; from the Butts collection; acquired from Butts's grandson, Captain Butts between 1903 and 1906 by the late W. Graham Robertson; bequeathed by Robertson to his executor, Kerrison Preston about 1948; presented by Preston with his Blake collection to the City of Westminster Reference Library in 1967.

desc.objtitle:
3 March 1807 Receipt, Thomas Butts, 3 March 1807,
Object 1 (Bentley Receipt 11)

objnote.p: This receipt is written and signed by Blake.

To the left of the text is an embossed revenue stamp depicting a coronet and sprigs of long, narrow leaves on its left and right. The word “RECEIPT” appears at the top and the words “EIGHT PENCE” at the bottom.
In the top right corner, the number "6" is inscribed in pencil in an unknown hand.
Blake writes the latter half of the receipt (lines 4-7) in pencil. Bentley (*Blake Records*, page 767) notes that the figures in pencil itemize the work for which the money was due.

lg.l: Recievd RecievedMarch 3. 1807 of Mr Butts the Sum of
Twenty Eight Pounds Six Shillings on Account

l.note: Bentley (*Blake Records*, page 767) and Keynes (*Letters*, page 124) read âDrawingsâ, but the second and third characters are unclear in the manuscript.
